text:
Adding a new field property on the company just to determine if is part of an enrollment or was enrolled in the past is more like a workaround, it should work indeed if you refer to this approach. But not sure if I can do this retroactively for all the companies already enrolled in the past in some workflows.

I was just looking to HubSpot request from the application and this is how I get to this endpoint <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/automationapps/v1/history?portalId=x> it does exactly what I need but cannot be accessed without being logged in HubSpot App (csfr + some HubSpot cookies)
Did you find anything on your issue?

Hi, I'm new here and I've been searching and reading the documentation on how to associate conversations with contacts that don't have a conversation linked, using the HubSpot API. I've tried using the conversation's ThreadID, but it doesn't seem to work; the API response for associations is a 207 HTTP error indicating that the ID doesn't exist. Thank you in advance to anyone who knows how to do this! Much appreciated!

Hey all, I have a very specific use case am not sure can be done on HubSpot but I'll ask anyway.

Is there a way I can check if, the next open slot on a specific meeting link is 7 days away = Notify team

Hi, I'm currently getting contact list membership by calling
```/crm/v3/lists/{ILS List ID}/memberships```
then searching the list for the contact's ID. Is there a property or search param way to call the contacts api and get the individual contact's memberships back or another more efficient way to retrieve this info for a single contact? Thank you much
